Jacob Habtemariam

Full Stack Web Developer from Reisterstown, Maryland. Completed the Full Stack Coding Bootcamp at Johns Hopkins University focused on the MERN Stack. I enjoy creating web applications and continue to learn more about Software Development every day.

Projects

  • Google Bookshelf

    Full Stack application made with React, Node JS, and MongoDB that allows the user to search for books via the Google Books API and save the books to their own collection.

  • Off The Menu

    Full stack React application that allows users with food allergies to search local restaurant menus in order to find foods that are safe for them to eat. User allergens are stored in a database and displayed on their profile page. The application features a Mongo + Express backend that serves to a React frontend.

  • Weather App

    Weather dashboard application built with React JS. This app allows the user to search the OpenWeather API for a city and display the city's current weather and 5 day forecast.

  • Todo Application

    A simple todo application created with React JS. This application allows the user to enter a list of todos in order to better organize their daily tasks. The user is able to mark todos as complete and remove them from their list. Todo data is persisted with local storage.

  • Calculator

    Calculator application made with React and the MathJS library. The calculator features a simple design and can complete the four basic mathematical operations.

  • Password Generator

    Jquery based web application that allows the user to create a random password with uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers, and special characters. The application also enforces minimum and maximum password length.
